=== Instructions on installing Ubuntu 8.04 on 64MB RAM or below ===

Due to <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debian-installer/+bug/202959|Bug #202959]]</nowiki> the latest Ubuntu Version "Hardy Heron" (8.04) is currently not able to install '''at all''' on 64MB or less.
Here's a workaround:

===== 1) Ubuntu 7.10 (Gutsy) Command-Line Installation =====
* Download the <nowiki>[[http://torrent.ubuntu.com:6969/file?info_hash=%06%DA%2A%9F%C6%7D%40N%26%B9g7%7D%D0B%93%D9.%BFt|Gutsy Alternate ISO]]</nowiki>
* Select '''Command-line installation''' at the boot prompt
* Proceed the installation

===== 2) Prepare Upgrade to 8.04 (Hardy) =====
* this command changes all instances of 'gutsy' to 'hardy' in /etc/apt/sources.list
<code>sudo sed -i 's|gutsy|hardy|g' /etc/apt/sources.list</code>
* this command outcomments the old (Gutsy) CDROM entry
<code>sudo sed -i 's|deb cdrom|#deb cdrom|g' /etc/apt/sources.list</code>
	
===== 3) Optional: Use Hardy CDROM for upgrading =====

You can '''save time and traffic''' by adding the <nowiki>[[http://torrent.ubuntu.com:6969/file?info_hash=%A5nJ_%F6i%F0%FEG%85%99%B0%A04%24bG%A7.z|Hardy Alternate ISO]]</nowiki> to the sources.list - just put it into the tray and run this command:
<code>sudo apt-cdrom add</code>

===== 4) Upgrade! =====

<code>sudo apt-get dist-upgrade</code>
	
Afterwards reboot and install your minimal desktop (icewm, fluxbox et.al).

<code>sudo reboot</code>
